content:
Exec Class

Definition

Implements the Exec task. Use the Exec element in your project file to create and execute this task. For usage and parameter information, see Exec Task.

In this Article

public class Exec : Microsoft.Build.Tasks.ToolTaskExtension
Inheritance
Object
Task
ToolTask
Microsoft.Build.Tasks.ToolTaskExtension
Exec

Inherited Members

AddResponseFileCommands(CommandLineBuilderExtension)
Bag
GenerateCommandLineCommands()
GenerateResponseFileCommands()
GetBoolParameterWithDefault(String,Boolean)
GetIntParameterWithDefault(String,Int32)
HasLoggedErrors
Log
BuildEngine
BuildEngine2
BuildEngine3
BuildEngine4
HelpKeywordPrefix
HostObject
TaskResources
CallHostObjectToExecute()
Cancel()
DeleteTempFile(String)
EchoOff

EnvironmentVariables

ExitCode
GetProcessStartInfo(String,String,String)
GetResponseFileSwitch(String)
InitializeHostObject()
LogStandardErrorAsError

ResponseFileEscape(String)
SkipTaskExecution()
StandardErrorImportance
StandardErrorImportanceToUse
StandardOutputImportance
StandardOutputImportanceToUse
TaskProcessTerminationTimeout
Timeout
ToolCanceled
ToolExe

UseCommandProcessor
YieldDuringToolExecution
Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Constructors

Exec()

Initializes a new instance of the Exec class.

public Exec ();

Properties

Command

Gets or sets the command to run.

public string Command { get; set; }
Value
String

The command to run.

Remarks

The command to run can be a system command, such as attrib, or an executable, such as program.exe.

ConsoleOutput

Returns the output as an Item. Whitespace is trimmed.

ConsoleOutput is enabled when ConsoleToMSBuild is true. This avoids holding lines in memory if they aren't used. ConsoleOutput is a combination of stdout and stderr.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] ConsoleOutput { get; set; }
Value
ITaskItem[]

Returns ITaskItem.

ConsoleToMSBuild

Enable the standard output to pipe to an item. (StandardOutput).

public bool ConsoleToMSBuild { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

Returns Boolean.

CustomErrorRegularExpression

Gets or sets a regular expression to spot error lines in the tool output.

public string CustomErrorRegularExpression { get; set; }
Value
String

A regular expression to spot error lines in the tool output.

Remarks

This property is useful for tools that produce unusually formatted output.

CustomWarningRegularExpression

Gets or sets a regular expression to spot warning lines in the tool output.

public string CustomWarningRegularExpression { get; set; }
Value
String

A regular expression to spot warning lines in the tool output.

Remarks

This property is useful for tools that produce unusually formatted output.

IgnoreExitCode

Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the Exec task should ignore the exit code provided by the executed command (true) or should return false if the executed command returns a non-zero exit code (false).

public bool IgnoreExitCode { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the Exec task should ignore the exit code provided by the executed command; false if the Exec task should return false if the executed command returns a non-zero exit code.

IgnoreStandardErrorWarningFormat

Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether to ignore the standard error and warning format and log errors and warnings from the output as regular messages.

public bool IgnoreStandardErrorWarningFormat { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the Exec task should ignore the standard error and warning format and should log errors and warnings as regular messages; false if the Exec task should log the errors and warnings that match the standard error and warning format.

Remarks

The default value is false.

Outputs

Gets or sets the output items from the task.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] Outputs { get; set; }
Value
ITaskItem[]

The output items from the task.

Remarks

The Exec task does not set the output items. Instead, you can provide the output items as if they were set by the task, so that they can be used later in the project.

StandardErrorEncoding

Gets the encoding of the captured task standard error stream.

protected override System.Text.Encoding StandardErrorEncoding { get; }
Value
Encoding

The encoding of the captured task standard error stream.

StandardErrorLoggingImportance

Gets the importance to log ordinary messages with in the standard error stream.

protected override Microsoft.Build.Framework.MessageImportance StandardErrorLoggingImportance { get; }
Value
MessageImportance

The importance to log ordinary messages with in the standard error stream.

StandardOutputEncoding

Gets the encoding of the captured task standard output stream.

protected override System.Text.Encoding StandardOutputEncoding { get; }
Value
Encoding

The encoding of the captured task standard output stream.

StandardOutputLoggingImportance

Gets the importance to log ordinary messages with in the standard out stream.

protected override Microsoft.Build.Framework.MessageImportance StandardOutputLoggingImportance { get; }
Value
MessageImportance

The importance to log ordinary messages with in the standard out stream.

StdErrEncoding

Gets or sets the encoding of the captured task standard error stream that is visible to the project.

public string StdErrEncoding { get; set; }
Value
String

The encoding of the captured task standard error stream that is visible to the project.

StdOutEncoding

Gets or sets the encoding of the captured task standard output stream that is visible to the project.

public string StdOutEncoding { get; set; }
Value
String

The encoding of the captured task standard output stream that is visible to the project.

ToolName

Gets the name of the tool (cmd.exe).

protected override string ToolName { get; }
Value
String

The name of the tool (cmd.exe).

WorkingDirectory

Gets or sets the directory in which the command will run.

public string WorkingDirectory { get; set; }
Value
String

The directory in which the command will run.

Methods

AddCommandLineCommands(CommandLineBuilderExtension)

Generates command line arguments that the command line tool must run directly from the command line and not from a response file.

protected override void AddCommandLineCommands (Microsoft.Build.Tasks.CommandLineBuilderExtension commandLine);
commandLine
CommandLineBuilderExtension

Command line builder to add arguments to.

ExecuteTool(String,String,String)

Executes the cmd.exe tool, waits for its completion, and cleans up the batch file after execution completes.

protected override int ExecuteTool (string pathToTool, string responseFileCommands, string commandLineCommands);
pathToTool
String

The path to the tool to execute.

responseFileCommands
String

Command line arguments that should go into a temporary response file.

commandLineCommands
String

Command line arguments that should be passed to the tool directly.

Returns
Int32

The exit code that the tool returns.

Remarks

If errors were logged and the tool has an exit code of zero, then this method sets the exit code to -1.

GenerateFullPathToTool()

Returns the full path to the system tool cmd.exe.

protected override string GenerateFullPathToTool ();
Returns
String

The full path to the system tool cmd.exe.

GetWorkingDirectory()

Returns the working directory to use for the tool process.

protected override string GetWorkingDirectory ();
Returns
String

The working directory to use for the tool process.

Remarks

If the working directory is UNC, returns the system path %SystemRoot%\System32.

HandleTaskExecutionErrors()

Logs error message and handles exit code.

protected override bool HandleTaskExecutionErrors ();
Returns
Boolean

true if exit code was ignored; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This method will only be called with a non-zero exit code.

LogEventsFromTextOutput(String,MessageImportance)

Logs the specified single line of text as an error or warning if the single line matched custom or standard error and warning formats or as a regular message if crosoft.Build.Tasks.Exec.IgnoreStandardErrorWarningFormat* is set to true and no custom format matched.

protected override void LogEventsFromTextOutput (string singleLine, Microsoft.Build.Framework.MessageImportance messageImportance);
singleLine
String

Single line from the output to parse.

messageImportance
MessageImportance

The importance to log the message with.

LogPathToTool(String,String)

Logs the tool name and path.

protected override void LogPathToTool (string toolName, string pathToTool);
toolName
String

The tool name.

pathToTool
String

The current directory where the tool is run.

LogToolCommand(String)

Logs the batch file command to be executed.

protected override void LogToolCommand (string message);
message
String

Specify an empty string. This parameter is not used.

ValidateParameters()

Validates input parameters and logs errors or warnings, if any. Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether task execution should proceed.

protected override bool ValidateParameters ();
Returns
Boolean

true if task execution should proceed; otherwise, false.
